intro: Thevetia bicornuta, commonly known as the yellow oleander, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has smooth, often ribbed, green stems and lance-shaped leaves that are opposite in arrangement. Its flowers are typically 5-lobed and produce a sweet, sometimes fragrant scent. Thevetia bicornuta is also known for its toxic alkaloids, making it potentially harmful to livestock and humans if ingested.
